message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of identifying a small number of infected individuals in a large population using group testing. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), as well as algorithms and data structures (cs.DS), discrete mathematics (cs.DM), machine learning (cs.LG), and social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper proposes a novel algorithm for one-stage group testing, which suggests a focus on algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). However, the paper also considers two-stage designs and information-theoretic lower bounds, which are more closely related to information theory (cs.IT) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The problem of group testing is also relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and social and information networks (cs.SI), as it involves identifying patterns and connections within a large dataset. Overall, the most likely categories are cs.IT and cs.DS, followed by cs.DM, cs.LG, and cs.SI.
